vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/c7ef1ece-a170-42e6-80fc-86889073f6e7">USA</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>OECD National Accounts</i> presents a series of databases all containing data related to national accounts and their components including comparable statistics for key indicators. Countries covered vary but generally include OECD countries and a select group of non-OECD countries. The database is updated on a quarterly and annual basis and runs from 1955.<br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in October 2006. The UK Data Service  web site includes further information on its <i>OECD National Accounts Statistics</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/national-accounts.aspx" title="OECD National Accounts dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/na/2011-09" title="OECD National Accounts latest database updates">latest database updates<a/>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (<i>{YYYY}</i>): National Accounts (<i>{Ed. Data download: YYYY-MM}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/na/2011-09">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/na/2011-09</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/economics/data/oecd-national-accounts-statistics_na-data-en" title="10.1787/na-data-en">10.1787/na-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database covers:<ul><li>Gross Domestic Product</li><li>lending</li><li>saving</li><li>income</li><li>household final consumption expenditure</li><li>detailed accounts for population and employment</li><li>exchange rates and purchasing power parities</li><li>total employment, self-employment, and employment by industry sector</li><li>Gross Domestic Product by type of expenditure and by industry</li><li>gross fixed capital formation by product and by institutional sector</li><li>components of disposable income.</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The OECD National Accounts Statistics run from 1955 onwards.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Countries covered include:  Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, United Kingdom, United States, European Union Member States.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>the database is updated annually and quarterly</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details</sampProc>         <collMode>See documentation for details</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
